javadoc:
A panel that is scrollable and uses a VariableHeightLayoutManager that
 deals with components of varying heights.

methods.name: getRootComponent
methods.comment:
Finds the highest-level Component parent for the given Component. This
 method will stop searching when it finds a Window parent.

params.name: component
params.comment: The child for which to locate the highest-level parent.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: pack
params.comment:
true means to fit as many components on a row, not worrying about lining up 
        columns; false means to fit as many components on a row, and line up the columns 
        as if in a grid

methods.javadoc: This method is in place because the clients of this panel are not the ones that construct this panel and thus cannot create the desired type of layout at construction time. This method has no effect if this panel was constructed with pack set to false, which makes this panel use a grid style layout. @param singleLineLayout True signals to put all children on a single row; false will use as many rows as are needed to layout all of the children.
methods.name: setUseSingleLineLayout
methods.comment:
This method is in place because the clients of this panel are not the ones that 
 construct this panel and thus cannot create the desired type of layout at construction time.
 This method has no effect if this panel was constructed with pack set to
 false, which makes this panel use a grid style layout.

params.name: singleLineLayout
params.comment:
True signals to put all children on a single row; false will use
        as many rows as are needed to layout all of the children.

methods.javadoc: Return the preferred size of the layout manager of this panel.
methods.name: getPreferredLayoutSize
methods.comment: Return the preferred size of the layout manager of this panel.

name: VariableHeightPanel
comment:
A panel that is scrollable and uses a VariableHeightLayoutManager that
 deals with components of varying heights.
